item.title: The Formula
item.description: A terse summary for the hasty and the impatient Successful “master” parents: Have a vision. They implement this intentionally and strategically. They are not passive. Make time to learn about parenting – often by reading. Adapt to the child. They study the child closely and tailor their approach. Define a few strict rules but let the child make the remaining decisions. Perform 8 key roles for their kids. The early learning partner The flight engineer The fixer The revealer The philosopher The model The negotiator The GPS The story behind the book “The Formula” is a collaboration between a Boston Globe reporter and a Harvard professor.

item.title: 13 Things Mentally Strong Parents Don't Do
item.description: A terse summary for the hasty and the impatient This book is a list of 13 bad behaviors and then a list of what you can do about each behavior as a parent. I like that its totally practical and you can immediately run out and start applying Amy Morin’s advice. By the way, I see plenty of my own flaws listed in the 13 bad kid behaviors. Thats a little uncomfortable.
